result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Damage or Threat to Property of Witness

records.addlTxt: 9:18 AM Defendant Avery L. Weaver not in court.  Attorney Samuel Louis Lawton in court for Avery L. Weaver.  Attorney Christian J Ness in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and appearances. No appearance by defendant. State requests warrant-Granted.  Bond to be held for restitution purposes.

records.addlTxt:
9:45 AM Defendant Avery L. Weaver in court.  Attorney Samuel Louis Lawton in court for Avery L. Weaver.  Attorney Christian J Ness in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and appearances. State calls Deputy Drew Knoop to the stand. Clerk swears in. State begins questioning. Objection from Atty Lawton-Court finds the witness has identified the defendant. Nothing further. Cross from Atty Lawton. Nothing further. Court questions the witness. Nothing further. Witness excused. Argument. Court finds probable cause. Bond to continue.
Arraignment scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 09:15 am.
